revised_title: Archicortex: A Theory for Simple Memory
tldr: The authors propose a theory for archicortex, a simple and primitive part of the mammalian brain, which they believe performs a simple memorizing task. They develop a neural model that captures the essence of archipallial cortex and explore its storage capacity and recall abilities. The theory is then applied to the hippocampal cortex, resulting in several testable predictions.
